titles.title: Yuu Gi Ou: Arc-V
遊戯王 アーク・ファイブ
Yu-Gi-Oh! Arc-V
Yu-Gi-Oh! Arc Five
遊☆戯☆王ARC-V
Yu-Gi-Oh! Arc-V
Yu-Gi-Oh! Arc-V
游戏王ARC-V

relatedanime.anime: Yuu Gi Ou: Duel Monsters GX

recommendations.recommendation: Strong characters and fine enough animation that slowly lose their value over time. Although not as bad as the developments of 5D`s, it may turn you off.

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch64494 [Sakaki Yuuya] is a 14-old-year student who wants to become a professional entertainment duellist to give everyone a smile, but one day, he ends up fighting an exhibition match against the current champion of the Pro Duel World. This fight will lead him to make a decision, and confront the difficulties to make his dream come true. Source: ANN

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: summoning
tag.description: Ability to call/materialize some kind of creature.

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: zettai ryouiki
tag.description: "Absolute Territory" (絶対領域, Zettai Ryouiki in Japanese) describes the area of uncovered thigh between the skirt and the knee sock. As per usual for fandom who obsess about costumes, this can be considered a moe attribute and thus, present prominently in character designs and schoolgirl outfits. The term originates from http://anidb.net/a22 [Neon Genesis Evangelion] to designate an area of Absolute Terror, although it`s had considerable semantic drift. In this case, it may jokingly refer to the fact it emphasizes a shorter skirt without actually becoming creepy and showing the underpants. As if that wasn`t enough, some even categorize it into five "Grades", from E to A. Only the top two (A and B) are considered true Zettai Ryouiki and they are only usable by female characters. Some researchers additionally introduce Grade S, the highest one which consists of Grade A plus further requirements to personality and hairstyle. Just to make it clear, Zettai Ryouiki is made up of three components: socks, skin, and skirt. An Action Girl may trade the latter for hotpants but if it doesn`t include knee-highs and thighs, it`s not Zettai Ryouiki. Panty Shot is an entirely different zone. For more information on sock lengths in general, see also: http://anidb.net/t6419 [hosiery] Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: merchandising show
tag.description: The bane of the parent`s wallet; this show usually has only a single reason for existence: to advertise the toy line it is based upon to the intended target audience. The variety of toys can range from accessories for girls and boys, to cards and figures or models. Most often the ability of the toys will be exaggerated or invokes magic to work in the anime. The toys`s names will also be continuously repeated in the anime, often accompanied by flashy effects and loud shouting. Combined with an intricate story that typically involves an adventure or a tournament of sorts, it makes for an effective commercial.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: defeat means friendship
tag.description: In a series based around an endless series of one-on-one fights, defeating a Worthy Opponent or The Rival will sometimes convert them to the hero`s side, if not always to his cause. Furthermore, no matter how many people the Worthy Opponent has killed, how much grief he has caused, even if he slaughtered helpless children or the hero`s own family, as soon as he shows a bit of remorse or goes out of his way to help the hero even once, he will be welcomed into the hero`s circle of True Companions with open arms. (Source: TVTropes)

tag.name: inter-dimensional travel
tag.description: Inter-dimensional travel is the ability to move between dimensions. It is often also explained as moving between dimensional planes. Holders of this ability are generally called sliders.

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: visible aura
tag.description: Characters are surrounded by a visible energy field usually representing inner strength, but not restricted to only that.

tag.name: mundane made awesome
tag.description: Sometimes normal just doesn`t cut it. Eating: you put food in your mouth and chew. Playing sports: you throw a ball around. You need to make it awesome, no matter how mundane it is. Let`s throw in some gripping orchestral music, lighting changes, different camera angles, something! Don`t write like a man, write like an evil overlord! Exaggerate your expressions and gestures, speak with excessive intonation, and if all else fails, throw in some close-ups, slow motion, and ominous Latin chanting! With practice, even you can turn something like eating chips into an epic battle of light and dark, blinding the viewer with sheer awesomeness. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: Engrish
tag.description: Engrish is actually a mispronunciation of English, as can be the result of someone, who does not have English as their primary language of origin (such as Japanese or Chinese). Occasionally characters in the original Japanese dialogue version of an anime will speak in English... however; this often still requires the assistance of subtitles, for while the words are meant to be said in English, the sentence structure and letter pronunciation may still be strongly related to the person’s primary language.

tag.name: serious business
tag.description: For some people it is just a card- or board game. For others it is not just a matter of life and death — it is much more important than that. Serious business basically describes a situation, when a show revolves around an activity where a sizeable portion of the in-series population takes it far more seriously than it should. If something`s popularity rivals that of Elvis, or if there are mainstream schools devoted to it instead of teaching reading, writing, and arithmetic; it is serious business.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: card games
tag.description: A card game is any game using playing cards as the primary device with which the game is played, be they traditional or game-specific. Countless card games exist, including families of related games (such as poker). A small number of card games played with traditional decks have formally standardized rules, but most are folk games whose rules vary by region, culture, and person. Many games that are not generally placed in the family of card games do in fact use cards for some aspect of their gameplay. Similarly, some games that are placed in the card game genre involve a board. The distinction is that the gameplay of a card game primarily depends on the use of the cards by players (the board is simply a guide for scorekeeping or for card placement), while board games (the principal non-card game genre to use cards) generally focus on the players` positions on the board, and use the cards for some secondary purpose.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Jack Atlas
character.description: An alternate version of http://anidb.net/ch7204 [Jack Atlas] in http://anidb.net/a10310 [Yu-Gi-Oh! ARC-V].

character.name: Crow Hogan
character.description: An alternate version of http://anidb.net/ch7726 [Crow Hogan] in http://anidb.net/a10310 [Yu-Gi-Oh! ARC-V].

character.name: Tenjou Kaito
character.description: An alternate version of http://anidb.net/ch77759 [Tenjou Kaito] in http://anidb.net/a10310 [Yu-Gi-Oh! ARC-V].

character.name: Tenjouin Asuka
character.description: An alternate version of http://anidb.net/ch42320 [Tenjoin Asuka] in http://anidb.net/a10310 [Yu-Gi-Oh! ARC-V].

character.name: Ed Phoenix
character.description: An alternate version of http://anidb.net/ch80506 [Ed Phoenix] in http://anidb.net/a10310 [Yu-Gi-Oh! ARC-V].

character.name: Yeager
character.description: An alternate version of http://anidb.net/ch7292 [Yeager] in http://anidb.net/a10310 [Yu-Gi-Oh! ARC-V].

character.name: Zarc
character.description: Zarc`s revived body once his reincarnations combine.

episode.title: 光の軌跡, ペンデュラム召喚!
The Trail of Light: Pendulum Summon!
Hikari no Kiseki, Pendulum Shoukan!
episode.summary: Swing into action with the dueltainer Yuya Sakaki as he takes center stage in an all-new Action Duel where running, jumping, diving and dueling can make you a champion! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決闘[デュエル]最強進化系!! その名はアクションデュエル
The Strongest Evolution of Dueling!! Its Name Is Action Duel
Duel Saikyou Shinkakei!! Sono Na wa Action Duel
episode.summary: With The Sledgehammer set to strike, Yuya uses Pendulum power to swing the duel his way! Can this phenomenal new summoning method help Yuya hammer the Hammer? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 一筋の希望!! ブロックスパイダー
A Strand of Hope!! Block Spider!
Hitosuji no Kibou!! Block Spider
episode.summary: Still shocked by Sylvio’s Pendulum Summon, Yuya must find his focus if he wants to save his friends from a 100-story drop! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダークタウン 奪われたペンデュラム召喚!!
Dark Town: The Stolen Pendulum Cards
Dark Town Ubawareta Pendulum Shoukan!!
episode.summary: It could be curtains for Yuya when a rival student cons him out of his Pendulum Cards! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 弟子入り志願!? おかしなおっかけ「紫雲院素良」
An Aspiring Apprentice? Shiuin Sora`s Peculiar Pursuit!
Deshiiri Shigan!? Okashi na Okkake "Shiun`in Sora"
episode.summary: The new kid in town drives Yuya bananas when he begs Yuya to be his duel teacher! Unfortunately for Yuya, this blue-haired battler won’t give up until Yuya gives in! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 遊勝塾の危機!! LDS襲来
The Duel School`s Crisis! LDS` Attack
Yuushou Juku no Kiki!! LDS Shuurai
episode.summary: The Leo Institute is looking to take over Yuya’s duel school, and they’re bringing 3 of their most dangerous duelists to take down whoever dares stand in their way! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 反旗の逆鱗ダーク・リベリオン・エクシーズ・ドラゴン
Imperial Outrage`s Standard of Revolt! Dark Rebellion XYZ Dragon!
Hanki no Gekirin Dark Rebellion Xyz Dragon
episode.summary: Still steaming from his loss to Yuya, Sylvio looks to get some payback! But when Zuzu steps in to stop his plans, a mysterious stranger comes out of the shadows to show her how it’s done! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 無邪気な融合玩具[おもちゃ] デストーイ・シザー・ベアー
The Innocent Toy: Death-Toy Scissor Bear
Mujaki na Omocha Death-Toy Scissor Bear
episode.summary: Yuya’s getting schooled by his wannabe student, Sora! Can Yuya turn things around and teach Sora a lesson about winning, or is Yuya’s Pendulum power not going to make the grade? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: DDD 異次元の王
DDD the King from Another Dimension
DDD Ijigen no Ou
episode.summary: It’s a battle under the big top, but no one’s clowning around! Yuya duels Declan to determine the fate of Yuya’s duel school! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 身剣一体!! シンクロ使い「刀堂刃[とうどう やいば]」
One with His Sword!! Synchro User Toudou Yaiba
Shinken Ittai!! Synchro Tsukai "Toudou Yaiba"
episode.summary: It’s all up to Gong to save You Show from falling into the hands of the Leo Institute! Can Gong stare down defeat without moving his feet, or will a sword-swinging Syncro Summoner slice and dice his way to victory? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 秘石の騎士! 融合使い「光津真澄[こうつ ますみ]」
Knights of the Sacred Stones! Fusion User Koutsu Masumi
Hiseki no Kishi! Yuugou Tsukai "Koutsu Masumi"
episode.summary: It’s a gem of a duel when Zuzu faces a fierce Fusion Summoner whose jewel monsters are a cut above the rest! Can Zuzu and her Divas belt out a victory, or will the Leo Institute’s diamond of a duelist force a final face-off? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 星々の裁き! エクシーズ使い「志島北斗」
The Judgement of the Stars, XYZ User Shijima Hokuto
Hoshiboshi no Sabaki! Xyz Tsukai "Shijima Hokuto"
episode.summary: The battle to save Yuya’s duel school goes galactic when Yuya faces off against Leo Institute’s Dipper, an out-of-this-world duelist whose interstellar skills could have Yuya seeing stars! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔導賢者ガリレイ, ケプラー
Philosophers of Prophecy, Galilei and Kepler!
Madou Kenja Galilei, Kepler
episode.summary: Declan has a surprise in store that could swing the duel his way! Can Yuya take down the best the Leo Institute has to offer, or will Declan’s deck prove to be unbeatable? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 熱血!! 修造劇場
Hot-Blooded!! Shuuzou Theater
Nekketsu!! Shuuzou Gekijou
episode.summary: Yuya’s down in the dumps, but Principal Boyle’s not having it! Looking to snap Yuya out of his funk, Skip challenges Yuya to a duel to prove that the show must go on! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 目指せジュニアユース選手権!!
Aim for the Top Junior Youth Championship!!
Mezase Junior Youth Senshuken!!
episode.summary: Still stinging from her defeat against the Leo Institute, Zuzu turns to an unlikely source for some assistance – Sora! But before her training can commence, a familiar looking stranger shows up, putting her lesson on hold! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天才料理人『茂古田未知夫[もこた みちお]』
The Prodigy Chef, Mokota Michio!
Tensai Ryourinin "Mokota Michio"
episode.summary: Yuya is served a heaping helping of culinary catastrophe when he duels a celebrity chef with a menu full of merciless food monsters! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 豪快披露!! 満腹全席!
Full Stomach Warning! The Fearsome Guest Entertainment!
Goukai Hirou!! Manpuku Zenseki!
episode.summary: The table is set for a frenzied food fight to the finish! Can Yuya handle what Chef Pepper dishes out, or will he lose a lot more than his appetite? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 反逆の2つの影
Twin Shadows of Rebellion
Hangyaku no Futatsu no Kage
episode.summary: It’s a case of mistaken identity when Yuya is eyed as the primary suspect for attacking Leo students! But when Yuya crosses paths with the real culprit, things go from bad to worse! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 知識の宇宙!! 九庵堂栄太[きゅうあんどう えいた]
Universe of Knowledge!! Kyuuandou Eita!
Chishiki no Uchuu!! Kyuuandou Eita
episode.summary: Yuya matches minds with the quiz whiz extraordinaire Pierre L’Supérieure in a duel of wits! Can Yuya outsmart the smartest boy on Earth, or will Yuya end up scratching his head in defeat? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 難問!? アタックデュエルクイズ!!
Difficult Questions!? Attack Duel Quiz!!
Nanmon!? Attack Duel Quiz!!
episode.summary: In the finale of the mind-bending match that’s part-duel, part-quiz show - one wrong answer could mean curtains for Yuya! Can he outduel and outthink a trivia whiz who’s never wrong? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 反逆の翼 レイド・ラプターズ
Wings of Rebellion Raid Raptors
Hangyaku no Tsubasa Raid Raptors
episode.summary: Mysteries are revealed when the masked duelist who’s been terrorizing Leo Institute students is confronted and challenged to a battle royal! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 秘術の眼[まなこ]
Arcane Eye
Hijutsu no Manako
episode.summary: As Yuya’s battle against the fortunetelling predictress Aura flares to its finish, it becomes crystal clear that Yuya’s danger-filled future is becoming a reality! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 占い少女 方中[ほうちゅん]ミエル
Fortune Telling Girl, Houchun Mieru
Uranai Shoujo Houchun Mieru
episode.summary: Yuya’s future takes a terrifying turn for the worse when he battles a fortunetelling foe who predicts this will be his last duel ever! Can Yuya fix his fate and avoid a devastating disaster, or has his luck finally run out? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ペンデュラムのその先に
Beyond the Pendulum
Pendulum no Sono Saki ni
episode.summary: Duelists throughout the city are continuously being attacked, and everyone is on the search to find out the who, how and why! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 不動の覚悟!! 権現坂昇
Steadfast Resolve!! Gongenzaka Noboru
Fudou no Kakugo!! Gongenzaka Noboru
episode.summary: Yuya needs one more win to get into the Championship, but it will be his most difficult battle yet when he discovers he has to beat his best bud Gong in order to move on! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新たな地平 超重荒神[ちょうじゅうこうじん]スサノ－O[スサノオー]
A New Horizon, Superheavy Koujin Susano-O
Arata na Chihei Choujuu Koujin Susa-no-Ou
episode.summary: The battle between best buds Yuya and Gong for a spot in the Arc League Championships rages to a friend-zied finish! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 開幕!! 舞網チャンピオンシップ
Opening Match! Maiami Championship!
Kaimaku!! Maiami Championship
episode.summary: Let the games begin! The top duelists from around the globe have gathered together for the Arc League Championships to find out who’s the best duelist in the world! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アユのエンタメ水族館[アクアリウム]
Ayu`s Entertainment Aquarium
Ayu no EnteMe Aquarium
episode.summary: Allie is looking to make a big splash at the Arc League Championship, but she soon finds herself in over her head! Can Allie’s deck of fishy friends turn the tides, or will her mysterious opponent sink her chances of winning? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 融合する音姫!
The Fusing Fantasia Primas!
Yuugou Suru Otohime!
episode.summary: Zuzu takes center stage in an epic rematch against Leo Institute’s dueling diamond, Julia Krystal! Will Zuzu avenge her earlier loss and walk away a winner, or will history repeat itself and leave Zuzu singing the blues? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 試される不動の心
The Tested Steadfast Spirit!
Tamesareru Fudou no Kokoro
episode.summary: When Gong’s old sparring partner sets a trap for Yuya, the only way Gong can save his friend is to forfeit his duel and get tossed from the tourney! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 唸る旋風 妖仙ロスト・トルネード!
Howling Whirlwind! Yousen Lost Tornado!
Unaru Senpuu Yousen Lost Tornado!
episode.summary: Sylvio finally has just the thing to take Yuya down – a deck full of Pendulum Cards! Could Yuya`s days in the spotlight be done for? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 熱戦! エンタメデュエルショー!!
Heated Match! Entertainment Duel Show!!
Nessen! EnteMe Duel Show!!
episode.summary: Yuya is off his game and on the run as Sylvio zeroes in on zeroing out his life points! If Yuya can’t get into the swing of things, this could be his final performance! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 未来都市ハートランド
Future Metropolis Heartland
Mirai Toshi Heartland
episode.summary: Sora is psyched to put on a showstopping duel for the fans, but his opponent Shay is set to turn Sora’s one man show into a no man show! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 結合魔獣vs進化する隼
The Combining Demonic-Beast VS The Evolving Falcon
Ketsugou Majuu vs Shinka Suru Hayabusa
episode.summary: Sora and Shay`s heated duel hits its boiling point when dark secrets about their hidden history come to light! Could there be something sinister behind Sora’s sweet-toothed smile? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 4つの次元
The Four Dimensions
Yottsu no Jigen
episode.summary: Yuya is in a coma, and nothing has been able to stir him from his terrifying state! Is Yuya down for the count, or will his duelmate’s ESP and TLC make him A-OK? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 動き出す運命
The Destiny that Starts Moving
Ugokidasu Unmei
episode.summary: Yuya can’t believe his eyes when he finds himself standing face-to-face-to-face with two lookalikes who are out to destroy each other… and everything in sight! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 共鳴する竜
The Resonating Dragons
Kyoumeisuru Ryuu
episode.summary: Surprises are in the cards as the battle between Sora and Yuto comes to an unexpected conclusion! But just when Yuya thinks he’s seen everything, a new face shows up on the scene that makes Yuya do a triple take! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アカデミアとレジスタンス
The Academia and The Resistance
Academia to Resistance
episode.summary: While Yuto is looking for answers, Sora is looking to get some revenge! But when these two tangle, Yuya finds out more than he ever expected! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バトルロイヤル始動
Battle Royale Begins
Battle Royale Shidou
episode.summary: It’s time for a nail biting battle royal in the ARC League Championship! With four battle zones to choose from, the action has never been more mesmerizing or the duels more dangerous! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 野望の地 デュエルアカデミア
The Land of Ambition: Duel Academia
Yabou no Chi Duel Academia
episode.summary: Declan confronts Celina and shares a story from their past that reveals a frightening future! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アカデミアの戦士
The Warrior of Academia
Academia no Senshi
episode.summary: When a mysterious visitor threatens to throw the Championship into chaos, Declan moves in to uncover who they are and soon finds himself facing off against a merciless mercenary! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 逆鱗の覚醒
Awakening of the Imperial Wrath
Gekirin no Kakusei
episode.summary: It’s time for the second round of the Arc League Championship! Yuya is pitted against his polar opposite – a duelist who doesn`t duel to entertain, but rather put his foes into pain! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 反逆の覇王黒竜
The Rebellious Supreme King Black Dragon
Hangyaku no Haou Kokuryuu
episode.summary: Outnumbered, outmatched, and out of options, will Yuya tap into a deep-seeded darkness to overcome defeat? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 相克と相生
Destruction and Creation
Soukoku to Soujou
episode.summary: Yuya takes on a terrifying trio from Fusion Dimension who turn their victims into cards! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 紫雲院素良, 襲来!!
Shiun`in Sora, Storms Forth!!
Shiun`in Sora, Shuurai!!
episode.summary: As the battle royal rumbles on, Yuya finds himself caught in the crossfire when he stumbles across a battle between not-so-noble Knights! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 華麗なる留学生『デニス』
The Marvelous Exchange Student "Dennis"
Kareinaru Ryuugakusei "Dennis"
episode.summary: While Yuya is looking to knock the competition out cold in the Volcano Zone, the Iceberg Zone is heating up as Zuzu and Gong team up to defrost their foes! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 冷たい笑みのユーリ
Yuuri of the Cold-hearted Smile
Tsumetai Emi no Yuuri
episode.summary: Zuzu races to stay one step ahead of a cold-blooded hunter who`s hot on her heels! Can Zuzu ditch this danger, or will he prove too cunning for her to escape? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 手負いの隼
The Wounded Falcon
Teoi no Hayabusa
episode.summary: Sparks fly in the Volcano Zone when all our heroes face off against the full fury of Fusion Dimension’s elite Obelisk Force! With more than life points on the line, the action has never been hotter! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: デュエルで笑顔を
Bring Smiles with Duelling
Duel de Egao o
episode.summary: Are friends now foes as Yuya and Sora go deck to deck in a fiery face-off? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ランサーズ 選ばれた戦士
Lancers, the Chosen Warriors
Lancers Erabareta Senshi
episode.summary: When Yuya discovers Declan`s web of lies put his friends in danger, he challenges Declan to a battle as payback! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 反旗を揚げろ オッドアイズ・リベリオン・ドラゴン
Raise the Banner of Revolution: Odd-Eyes Rebellion Dragon
Hanki o Agero Odd-Eyes Rebellion Dragon
episode.summary: Yuya’s battle with Declan takes a turn for the worse when Declan’s majestic monsters give Yuya the royal treatment! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蘇る伝説総長!!
The Legendary Grandmaster Revives!!
Yomigaeru Densetsu Souchou!!
episode.summary: It’s a family feud when Yuya takes on his mom in a duel where there’s more to lose than just his allowance! Can Yuya avoid being run down by Paradise City’s most feared motorcycle momma? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 笑顔のデュエル「スマイル・ワールド」
"Smile World": A Duel Filled with Smiles
Egao no Duel "Smile World"
episode.summary: The battle between Yuya and his mom kicks into high gear! Can Yuya avoid being grounded, or will Loco Yoko put the pedal to the metal and throttle her way to victory? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シンクロ次元「シティ」
The Synchro Dimension "City"
Shinkuro City
episode.summary: As Zuzu and Yugo try to unravel the riddle of Yuya`s dimensional doubles, their sleuthing is cut short by Sector Security! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 治安の強制 デュエルチェイサーズ
Public Safety Coercion: The Duel Chasers
Chian no Kyousei Duel Chasers
episode.summary: Zuzu and Yugo redline their Duel Runner in a high-stakes Turbo Duel with Sector Security! Can they outrun the long arm of the law, or will Security put the brakes on their escape? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: セキュリティ完全包囲網!!
Security`s Perfect Encirclement!!
Security Kanzen Houimou
episode.summary: When Yuya and his pals arrive in the Synchro Dimension, Sector Security is waiting for them with open arms… and cuffs! Can Yuya smooth things out before Sylvio and Celina put a wrinkle in his plan? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黒い旋風[せんぷう] クロウ・ホーガン
The Black Whirlwind: Crow Hogan
Kuroi Senpuu: Crow Hougan
episode.summary: It’s a superheroic showdown in the Synchro Dimension pitting Super Gong against his arch-nemesis, Dennis the Destroyer! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闇デュエルへの招待
Invitation to the Dark Duel
Yami Duel e no Shoutai
episode.summary: Dennis and Gong are in for the ride of their lives when they’re introduced to the turbo-charged world of underground motorcycle dueling! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大エンタメデュエル大会!!
The Great Entertainment Duel Tournament!!
Dai Enterme-Duel Taikai!!
ドローを捨てた男
The Man Who Abandoned His Draw!
Draw o Suteta Otoko
地獄の沙汰もカード次第
Cards Determine Your Fate
Jigoku no Sata mo Card Shidai
episode.summary: Yuya learns the ins and outs of The Facility the hard way by coming face-to-face with the toughest and most dangerous duelist in the cell block: the Kingpin! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地下ライディング・デュエル!!
Underground Riding Duel!!
Chika Riding Duel!!
episode.summary: The battle between Dashin’ Dennis and Sweet Baby Shay hits a speedbump when Sector Security pulls the plug on their Turbo Duel! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 捕獲者の王「ゴヨウ・キング」
Goyo King, Lord of Captors
Hokakusha no Ou "Goyou King"
デュエルキング「ジャック・アトラス」

Duel King "Jack Atlas"
打ち砕かれたエンタメ
Crushed Entertainment
Uchikudakareta Enterme

All-Out Rebellion: Bee Force
B Force Issei Houki
ドラゴン征伐!! ユーゴvs沢渡
Slaying the Dragon!! Yugo vs Sawatari
Dragon Seibatsu!! Hugo vs Sawatari
キングス・ギャンビット
King`s Gambit
King`s Gambit

The Bond Between Teacher and Disciple
Shitei no Kizuna
強襲! オベリスク・フォース

Kyoushuu! Obelisk Force

Duel Machine of Destruction
Hametsu no Duel Machine
魂を刻んだ右腕
The Right Arm That Carved Souls
Tamashii o Kizanda Migiude
気高き超魔導剣士[ちょうまどうけんし]

Kedakaki Chou Madou Kenshi

Heartland City in Despair
Zetsubou no Miyako Heartland

華々しき機械天使[きかいてんし]

Hanabanashiki Kikai Tenshi

戦場に果てる隼[はやぶさ]

Kiba o Muku Suzu no Ne
